channel.title: Jolt v2: Login Manager Error
channel.description:
This error has had me stumped for a good 3+ hours and I don't quite understand what to do about it.
[code]-- SYSTEM ERROR DETECTED -- System.Net.Sockets.SocketException (0x80004005): An attempt was made to access a socket in a way for bidden by its access permissions at System.Net.Sockets.Socket.DoBind(EndPoint endPointSnapshot, SocketAddress socketAddress) at System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Bind(EndPoint localEP) at System.Net.Sockets.TcpListener.Start(Int32 backlog) at RuneScape.Commons.Network.ConnectionListener.Start(Boolean logConnections, Boolean checkBlackl ist) in C:\Users\AJ\Desktop\jolt v2 final\Source\RuneScape.Commons\Network\ConnectionListener.cs:lin e 117 at System.Dynamic.UpdateDelegates.UpdateAndExecuteVoid3[T0,T1,T2](CallSite site, T0 arg0, T1 arg1 , T2 arg2) at RuneScape.GameServer.Engine.Initialize()[/code]
While searching, I've read that it could be another port open on some other program. I used "netstat - an" in cmd to search for another program using all the ports I'm using and it seems that none are conflicting. I made sure Skype and Teamviewer are not using ports 443 and 80 by changing it in the settings. I also made sure no other appache applications were installed to conflict and still no success. I found it slightly peculiar that [code]C:\Users\AJ\Desktop\jolt v2 final\Source\RuneScape.Commons\Network\ConnectionListener.cs:line 117[/code] the error referenced the previous users file location instead of mine. I'm honestly trying to get this to work to the learning experience and would be greatly appreciative that someone could lend me an insightful eye upon this problem.

item.title: Jolt v2: Login Manager Error
item.dc:creator: @bananastreet bananastreet
item.description:
@bananastreet wrote:

This error has had me stumped for a good 3+ hours and I don’t quite understand what to do about it.

-- SYSTEM ERROR DETECTED -- System.Net.Sockets.SocketException (0x80004005): An attempt was made to access a socket in a way for bidden by its access permissions at System.Net.Sockets.Socket.DoBind(EndPoint endPointSnapshot, SocketAddress socketAddress) at System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Bind(EndPoint localEP) at System.Net.Sockets.TcpListener.Start(Int32 backlog) at RuneScape.Commons.Network.ConnectionListener.Start(Boolean logConnections, Boolean checkBlackl ist) in C:\Users\AJ\Desktop\jolt v2 final\Source\RuneScape.Commons\Network\ConnectionListener.cs:lin e 117 at System.Dynamic.UpdateDelegates.UpdateAndExecuteVoid3[T0,T1,T2](CallSite site, T0 arg0, T1 arg1 , T2 arg2) at RuneScape.GameServer.Engine.Initialize()

While searching, I’ve read that it could be another port open on some other program. I used “netstat - an” in cmd to search for another program using all the ports I’m using and it seems that none are conflicting. I made sure Skype and Teamviewer are not using ports 443 and 80 by changing it in the settings. I also made sure no other appache applications were installed to conflict and still no success. I found it slightly peculiar that C:\Users\AJ\Desktop\jolt v2 final\Source\RuneScape.Commons\Network\ConnectionListener.cs:line 117 the error referenced the previous users file location instead of mine. I’m honestly trying to get this to work to the learning experience and would be greatly appreciative that someone could lend me an insightful eye upon this problem.

Read full topic
